intro: Trichlora huascarana, commonly known as the Huascarana spurge, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes in Peru. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
